body:
<!-- Before reporting: search existing issues and check the FAQ. -->

- `nvim --version`:
```
 NVIM v0.5.0
Build type: Release
LuaJIT 2.1.0-beta3
Compilation: 
Compiled by nixbld

Features: +acl +iconv +tui
See ":help feature-compile"

   system vimrc file: "$VIM/sysinit.vim"
  fall-back for $VIM: "
/nix/store/y962zq0bqgiwyxshvsaxqcqw1dq9sz9z-neovim-unwrapped-0.5.0/share/nvim
"

Run :checkhealth for more info
```
- Operating system/version: nixos 21.05, linux x86_64
- Terminal name/version: xfce-terminal 0.8.10
- `$TERM`: vte-256color

I can also reproduce with xterm 367, TERM=xterm
### Steps to reproduce using `nvim -u NORC`

This only happens when a lightbulb is displayed in virtual text to indicate a code action so I need some plugins and configuration:
- gruvbox (yes ! if I remove gruvbox the issue is gone)
- lspconfig and lspsaga

init.vim:
```vim
" configuration generated by NIX
set nocompatible

set packpath^=/nix/store/hfc8im1aym22l67cgr15db0mrlsfcg8k-vim-pack-dir
set runtimepath^=/nix/store/hfc8im1aym22l67cgr15db0mrlsfcg8k-vim-pack-dir

let $PATH .= ":/nix/store/wh5qpj40df0bxan7583lg8g0slfp5r2d-provide-default-for-rust-analyzer-2021-05-17/bin"

lua << EOF
local nvim_lsp = require('lspconfig')
nvim_lsp.rust_analyzer.setup{}
require'lspsaga'.init_lsp_saga()
EOF

set background=dark
colorscheme gruvbox
```
The paths in the store are just the nix way to install the aforementioned plugins.

The issue happens when a lightbulb appears on a very long line.
To reproduce it with rust-analyzer:
create a very long string like this:
```
fn main() -> anyhow::Result<()> {
    println!("slkdfsmlfkjqsmdflkjqsmflkqjsdfmlqskjfqmsdlkfjqsmflkjqsmflkqsjdfmlqskjfqmslkfjqsmlfkjqsmflkqsjfmlqksjfmqlskdjflmk");
    Ok(())
}
```
put the cursor on the closing quote
wait for rust-analyzer to offer the code action

comment_data.body:
This might be caused because `data->print_attr_id` can be set to -1, e.g. in:

https://github.com/neovim/neovim/blob/fad1022cafd971c59e28ba34ec58d4866d2d5297/src/nvim/tui/tui.c#L421

Therefore this line:

https://github.com/neovim/neovim/blob/fad1022cafd971c59e28ba34ec58d4866d2d5297/src/nvim/tui/tui.c#L578

Leads into this other line:

https://github.com/neovim/neovim/blob/fad1022cafd971c59e28ba34ec58d4866d2d5297/src/nvim/tui/tui.c#L557

Note: `id1` is `data->print_attr_id`, which is -1.

So `kv_A` tries to look up index -1 and it crashes.

https://github.com/neovim/neovim/blob/91e912f8d40284c74d4a997c8c95961eebb35d91/src/klib/kvec.h#L66

---

I don't know how to come up with a reproduction to validate the above. Suggestions welcome. Thanks in advance.

@resolritter This cannot happen as it already bails out above:
https://github.com/neovim/neovim/blob/fad1022cafd971c59e28ba34ec58d4866d2d5297/src/nvim/tui/tui.c#L554-L556
